intro: Heracleum sphondylium f. elegans, commonly known as the slender cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its distinctive appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in botanical studies and natural habitats.
